dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 950 IH: Protecting America’s Civilian Employees Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Farenthold introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to send a report to Congress indicating how amounts could be transferred within agencies and departments for fiscal year 2013 to avoid all furloughs or reductions in force.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting America’s Civilian Employees Act or the PACE Act.

The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall prepare and submit a report to Congress indicating how amounts could be transferred within agencies and departments for fiscal year 2013 to avoid all furloughs or reductions in force without increasing the deficit of the Government for that fiscal year.
The report described in section 1 shall be submitted to the Congress not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
